title: Kale Salad with Preserved Lemon & Pecorino
ingredients: ½preserved lemon, homemade (see this page) or store-bought
1cup fresh basil leaves, chiffonade cut (see this page)
directions: 1. Add the kale to a large bowl. Drizzle with the lemon juice and 1 tablespoon olive oil and massage it into the kale for 1 to 2 minutes. Set the bowl aside.
2. Finely chop the preserved lemon into almost a paste. Add this and the garlic to the bottom of a second large bowl. Add the basil and kale and give everything a mix.

3. Chop the pistachios as finely as possible (think: bread crumbs) and add them to the bowl. Grate in the Pecorino (I use Olive Garden rules: stop whenever you’re ready), drizzle in 1 tablespoon olive oil, and mix again.
4. Taste and season with salt and black pepper, as needed, but it shouldn’t need much.
